article: An artist who had painted many pictures of great beauty found that he had not yet painted one "real" picture. In his _ along a dusty road, he met an aged priest who asked him where he was going. "I do not know," said the artist, "I want to paint the most beautiful thing in the world. Perhaps you can _ me to it." "How simple," replied the priest, "in any church, you will find it--'Faith' is the most beautiful thing in the world." The artist traveled on. _ , he met a young bride who told him that the most beautiful thing in the world is "Love". "Love" _ the world go round. It _ poverty into riches and sweetens tears. Without love there is no beauty. Still the artist _ his search and met a soldier. The artist asked him the _ question and the soldier answered, "'Peace' is the most beautiful thing in the world. 'War' is ugly and _ you find peace, you'll find Beauty, Faith and Love." "How can I _ them--Faith, Love and Peace?" thought the artist. As he resumed his walk, his mind _ the "real" picture he hoped to paint. He was _ that without thinking where he was going, he had reached his _ surroundings. As he entered the doorway, light glistened in his eyes and he _ that his search was over. In the _ of his wife and children, he saw Love and Faith. "Not a minute passed by that our children and I had not thought of you. We prayed that you would return to us _ ," his wife said as they embraced him. He sat on his _ old chair and his heart was at _ . Finally, the artist painted the most beautiful thing in the world and called it " _ ".
